name: 國際觀光管理管理與行銷
description: The course incorporates changes in the tourism system relating to destinations, channels of distribution, tourist markets, and modes of transportation. Each learning topic will stimulate students to discuss. In addition, the course highlights and emphasizes new topics such as competitiveness in the tourism market, tourism satellite accounts, the impact of climate change on tourism, the use of quality assurance programs, societal marketing campaigns and more
goals: 賦予觀光管理專業知識
增進國際觀光旅遊視野
掌握全球觀光發展趨勢及關鍵議題
掌握全球觀光發展趨勢及關鍵議題
syllabus:
Course Introduction 

•  Topic 1: Tourism: An Overview of the Tourism System

•  Topic 2: Why Do People Take Vacations? Needs, Wants, and Motivation

•  Topic 3: Selecting a Travel Destination: The Importance of Image

•  Topic 4: Travel Purchase: The Traveler’s Buying Process

•  Topic 5: Modes of Travel: Travel Alternatives

•  Topic 6: The Destination Mix: Attractions and Services for the Traveler

•  Topic 7: Tourism Impacts on the Economy, Society, Culture, and Environment: The Need for Sustainable Tourism Development

•  Topic 8: Tourism Policy and Organizations: Government Involvement in Tourism

Topic 9: Tourism Planning: Selecting Among Alternatives for the Future of Tourism

•  Topic 10: Tourism Development: Building a Sustainable Future for Tourism

•  Topic 11: Tourism Marketing: Bringing all of the Parts of Tourism Together

•  Topic 12: Tourism Promotion: Communicating with Target Markets

•  Topic 13: The Distribution Mix in Tourism: Getting Messages and Services to the Market

•  Topic 14: Forces Shaping Tourism: Culture, Time, Socioeconomics, Life Cycle Stages, Personality
